segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4
4. Situations
40. With Udāyī

segments.pli: Atha kho udāyī brāhmaṇo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā … pe … ekamantaṃ nisinno kho udāyī brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Udāyī the brahmin went up to the Buddha, … and asked him,
“Does Master Gotama praise sacrifice?”

segments.pli: “Na kho ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ yaññaṃ vaṇṇemi;
segments.en: “Brahmin, I don’t praise all sacrifices.

segments.pli: na panāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sabbaṃ yaññaṃ na vaṇṇemi.
segments.en: Nor do I criticize all sacrifices. …

segments.pli: Yathārūpe kho, brāhmaṇa, yaññe gāvo haññanti, ajeḷakā haññanti, kukkuṭasūkarā haññanti, vividhā pāṇā saṅghātaṃ āpajjanti;
segments.en: Take the kind of sacrifice where cattle, goats and sheep, chickens and pigs, and various kinds of animals are slaughtered.

segments.pli: evarūpaṃ kho ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sārambhaṃ yaññaṃ na vaṇṇemi.
segments.en: I don’t praise that kind of violent sacrifice.

segments.pli: Evarūpañhi, brāhmaṇa, sārambhaṃ yaññaṃ na upasaṅkamanti arahanto vā arahattamaggaṃ vā samāpannā.
Yathārūpe ca kho, brāhmaṇa, yaññe neva gāvo haññanti, na ajeḷakā haññanti, na kukkuṭasūkarā haññanti, na vividhā pāṇā saṅghātaṃ āpajjanti;
segments.en: But take the kind of sacrifice where cattle, goats and sheep, chickens and pigs, and various kinds of animals are not slaughtered.

segments.pli: evarūpaṃ kho ahaṃ, brāhmaṇa, nirārambhaṃ yaññaṃ vaṇṇemi, yadidaṃ niccadānaṃ anukulayaññaṃ.
segments.en: I do praise that kind of non-violent sacrifice; for example, a regular gift as an ongoing family sacrifice.

segments.pli: Evarūpañhi, brāhmaṇa, nirārambhaṃ yaññaṃ upasaṅkamanti arahanto vā arahattamaggaṃ vā samāpannāti.

segments.en: The kind of sacrifice that’s allowable and timely,
well prepared and non-violent,
is attended by
disciplined spiritual practitioners.
The Buddhas—who have drawn back the veil from the world,
transcending time and rebirth—
praise this sacrifice,
as they are expert in sacrifice.
When you’ve prepared a suitable offering,
whether as sacrifice or for ancestors,
sacrifice it with confident heart,
in the fertile field of spiritual practitioners.
When it’s well-gotten, well-offered, and well-sacrificed,
to those worthy of a religious donation,
a sacrifice is truly abundant,
and even the deities are pleased.
When an intelligent, faithful person,
sacrifices like this, with a mind of letting go,
that astute one is reborn
in a happy, pleasing world.”

sections.title: Then Udāyī the brahmin went up to the Buddha,…

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha criticizes violent sacrifice, but not non-violent giving.
